title: Airbus sales chief sees opportunities to improve A320 production rate
text:
February 6, 2018 / 7:17 AM / Updated 25 minutes ago Airbus sales chief sees opportunities to improve A320 production rate Reuters Staff 1 Min Read 
SINGAPORE (Reuters) - Airbus SE is closely looking at opportunities to improve its production rate of the A320 aircraft but has not yet taken any decision, its new commercial sales chief said on Tuesday. 
“The success of the product is forcing us to look at any opportunities we have to improve the rate. We have not come to any conclusion yet but this is something we are looking at very closely,” Eric Schulz told a news conference at the Singapore Airshow. 
It marked the first public appearance in the new role by Schulz, the replacement for legendary Airbus sales boss John Leahy, who retired last month after a strong end-of-2017 sales push that helped it beat rival Boeing Co in the annual orders race. Reporting by Jamie Freed and Tim Hepher; Writing by Anshuman DagaEditing by Muralikumar Anantharaman
